ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Solo Spectre Camp Break?
ygData.msgSnippet: Ah, good to know about the suicide aspect of my proposal. Of course, if it was easy, what would be the point. :-) I just figured it would be doable,
ygData.messageBody:
Ah, good to know about the "suicide" aspect of my proposal. Of course, if
it was easy, what would be the point. :-)

I just figured it would be doable, considering who slow these things are.
Cyclopses sometimes catch up to me due to their speed. My main concern was
the fear spells that these things cast.

Eventually I'll head over to Kunark. Hopefully soon.

---Windleaf

At 08:59 AM 6/28/00 -0500, you wrote:
>Spectres (and other mobs) agro is also partly based on a level check. The
>Spec island when fully populated has at least 4 (one each cornor) and 3
>(tower lower and 2 upper). At 33, given the social range, you will get
>multiple spectres. Also, your hp is no where near high enough to sustain
>any amount of damage from them. At level 45, it was damn hard for me to
>solo spectres there. The problem being getting multiple pulls and resists.
>By 47, it was loads easier to pull singles and I still used Lament alot. I
>just dont see this as being a productive venture for you at 33.
>
>On the other hand, you should be able to find loads of stuff to charm kite
>in the great outdoors over in Kunark.
>
>Sylly Songsynger
>(The Pantheon)
>Minstrel somewhere on Innoruuk...
>
>
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: John Tatsukawa [mailto:john@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, June 27, 2000 4:42 PM
>To: eqbards@egroups.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Solo Spectre Camp Break?
>
>
>I was cruising my little 'ol blue level 33 self across the Oasis and
>recalled that I was able to charm a Spectre not to long ago (with lots of
>resists, but I was successful).
>
>Has anyone successfully broken the camp solo? The Spectres are so slow and
>we can run over the water pretty easily, figured someone must have done
>this.
>
